content:
What part of syncronised have you missed. The server is considered canonical in that process so if there is nothing on the server any update to local profiles from a backup to put the mails back will immediately see them deleted to match the server.

If you have a copy of the files (the inbox etc files from the Thunderbird profile, copy them to a USN drive.

Install the importexport tools add-on in Thunderbird and import from those files to local folders. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/?src=ss

You can later try and copy the individual email from local folders to the gmail account, but it will be slow anf gmail will fight you all the way. batches not exceeding 500 email is probably the most you can copy at a time and remember there is a daily bandwidth limit on gmail so if you previously had a large store you may find many days of using the daily limit are required to move things back to where they used to be,
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
and yet I hasve exactly that, a highlight of the selected message. But the colours usaed in those are directly derived from the operating system and most folk that report these types of error do not use a default operating system theme.

Check in Thunderbird themes and try the light and dark themes as opposed to the default theme which is the one that listens to the operating system for the highlight colour.
creator: MattAuSupport

This worked properly as recently as a week ago, I think, but it's getting pretty annoying.

Searching for "highlight" in this context brought up a lot of hits for using the highlighter tool and other unrelated posts about background colors, but essentially nothing about this particular problem.

content:
You use telstra and expect a sane and reasonable process. I stopped using their email decades ago (perhaps only one) just as I stopped using their hopelessly incompetent support line. Neither actually worked as advertised and to make matters worse the support folk were in total ignorance of anything that was not in the script they read from and having matter elevated to level two support where folk that actually knew what email was worked generally took a complaint to the ombudsman.

Zero real support from the telstra support line. I used to just end up fighting with them as the fumbled and transferred me yet again to someone else in the hope of loosing the call and generally made me aware that I was not in control and they had not idea who actually was and cared even less.

I think I recall a recent change to their service where they changed all of their server settings for old bigpond accounts to use telstra branded servers. So let's start with you advising what settings you have in account settings for incoming and outgoing server (SMTP) and we can compare them to those published by telstra here https://www.telstra.com.au/support/email/imap-pop-smtp-mail-server-settings
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Proton mail non è accessibile da Thunderbird ne da nessun altro client di posta per scelta della stessa Proton.

Per aggirare questo limite è necessario usare Proton Mail Bridge che va installato e configurato nel tuo computer. Poi devi seguire le specifiche istruzioni per configurare Thunderbird all'uso del Bridge -> https://proton.me/support/protonmail-bridge-clients-windows-thunderbird

Purtroppo Proton ha scelto questa strada.
creator: @next

content:
Just to be brief: This is the help forum, intended to assist users who are having problems. On the start page of Thunderbird is a button with words "Get Help." When users click there, it brings them here. And, if users don't see that button and follow customary approach that is common with many software products and click the Help>about link, that also has the menu link for Help. Yes, this is the official forum for providing assistance.

To give recommendations for improvements, the start page has a button titled "Participate.' Clicking that brings up a page where users can click to the connect.mozilla.org page and the IDEAS section where recommendations can be posted. Developers do read these suggestions. I encourage you to follow that route to ensure your proposed restructuring of forums receives attention.

Thank you for your feedback. To my knowledge as a volunteer, I am not aware of any page designed for user/developer dialogue.
creator: davidsk

content:
> I'm not sure if this is supposed to be the official place to get help if you have problems with your Thunderbird install.

Certainly, as you will note in Thunderbird, Help > Get Help takes you here.

> It's so difficult to even get to the point where I'm able to post a question,

What part specifically after "Get Help" is difficult?
creator: wsmwk

content:
While you are here look at top for "Ask a Question > Thunderbird" where you get introduced to the KB articles for desktop Thunderbird and if you still want to post a thread then look to right on that page to see the Ask a Question for the form to create a thread as you did. Also if you are viewing a thread in Thunderbird section there is a Ask a Question form link at top of the sidebar on right.

Mozilla has made this custom software for the community support forums and Knowledge Base to work together. They also have the https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/forums/ which is for discussing things related to the support.mozilla.org site.

This https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/ has been around since oh 2007 for desktop Firefox before other products got added and it was about February 21, 2014 that this became the official place for Thunderbird users to get support since.
creator: James
